comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Sociologist Katharine Bement Davis (1861?-1935), New York CIty Corrections Commissioner beginning in 1914. www.correctionhistory.org/html/chronicl/kbd/kbdframe.html

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Appointed to her position by the newly-elected Mayor of New York, John Puroy Mitchel.

Another Bain/LOC portrait of Katherine Davis:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4626428653/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
pennylrichardsca:

Thanks for the further information on Dr. Davis. We will add to the record when we update.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Dr. Davis assumed her position as NYC's Commissioner of Corrections on January 1, 1914, and the Bain News Agency immediately circulated photos of her on the job:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4786749031/in/photostream/]

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4798745741/]
